properties.name: _id
properties.description: Automatically generated object_id as primary key.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the comment's creation date

properties.name: updatedAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the comment's last update date

properties.name: authorId
properties.description: Id of the user who created the comment.

properties.name: parentId
properties.description: If the comment is nested (in another comment), this field will hold the _id of the parent comment. Optional field, where being blank means it is a root comment.

properties.name: content
properties.description: Stirng holding the comment's content.
_id of the user who liked the comment

properties.name: likes
properties.description: Array holding the user_id of all the users who liked the comment.

collections.description: Document to represent a post, asking or offering help to be displayed on the feed

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the post's creation date

properties.name: updatedAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the post's last update date

properties.name: expireAt
properties.description:
Timestamp with the date the post will expire.
If no expiration date is present, the post does not expire.

properties.name: authorId
properties.description: Foreign key to the user who created the post.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The post title.

properties.name: description
properties.description: String for the post content.

properties.name: objective
properties.description:
Field to indicate the post's objective.
Currently only two values allowed: "offering help" and "looking for help".

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: Field to specify the post's visibility. It can be: worldwide, country, state and zipcode.
_id of the user who liked the post

properties.name: likes
properties.description: Array holding the user_id of all the users who liked the post.

properties.name: types
properties.description:
Array with the post's tags.
Can be: Medical Supplies, Groceries/Food, Business, Education, Legal, Wellbeing/Mental, Entertainment, Information, Funding, R&D and Others

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the user's creation date
properties.comments: Thu Apr 16 2020 04:59:24 GMT-0300 (HorÃ¡rio PadrÃ£o de BrasÃ­lia): changed the name to registeredAt

properties.name: updatedAt
properties.description: Timestamp indicating last update on the database.

properties.name: email
properties.description: User's email validated by a regex pattern.

properties.name: accessToken
properties.description: User's acess token. Shouldn't be required?

properties.name: firstName
properties.description: The first name of the user

properties.name: lastName
properties.description: The last name of the user. Optional field.

properties.name: _id
properties.description: Automatically generated _it as primary key.

properties.name: medicalHelp
properties.description:
Flag to indicate wheter the user needs medical help. 
Marking this indicates he shows symptoms of COVID-19.

properties.name: otherHelp
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the user needs non-medical help, such as getting groceries, medice and etc..

properties.name: needs
properties.description: User's need in the app, representing what kind of help he/she needs

properties.name: volunteer
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the user wants to volunteer for iniciatives through the app.

properties.name: donate
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the user wants to donate for iniciatives through the app.

properties.name: shareInformation
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the user wants to share information through the app.

properties.name: objectives
properties.description: Document with what are the objectives of the user through the application, such as donating, volunteering or sharing information.

properties.name: photo
properties.description: URI with the location of the profile's photo.

properties.name: facebookURL
properties.description: URL to user's Facebook page.

properties.name: linkedinURL
properties.description: URL to user's Linkedin page.

properties.name: twitterURL
properties.description: URL to user's Twitter page.

properties.name: githubURL
properties.description: URL to user's Github page.

properties.name: websiteURL
properties.description: URL to user's personal website.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Document holding the user urls to external websites and social networks

properties.name: about
properties.description: Small self-introduction, limited to 100 char

properties.name: _id
properties.description: Automatically generated _id.

properties.name: createdAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the comment's creation date

properties.name: updatedAt
properties.description: Timestamp with the comment's last update date

properties.name: authId
properties.description:
String holding the authentication service id (Auth0).

This field is a **foreign key to the user in the Auth0 database**, connecting through the user_id field.

properties.name: ownerId
properties.description: _id of the user who owns the organization.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Organization's name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Small description of the organization (limited to 100 char).

properties.name: global
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter this organization is global.

properties.name: linkedin
properties.description: URL to organization's Linkedin page.

properties.name: twitter
properties.description: URL to organization's Twitter page.

properties.name: website
properties.description: URL to organization's website.

properties.name: playstore
properties.description: URL to organization's page at Google Play Store.

properties.name: appstore
properties.description: URL to organization's page at Apple App Store

properties.name: urls
properties.description: Document holding external urls and refs to the organization such as social media profiles.

properties.name: photo
properties.description: URI with the location of the profile's photo.

properties.name: email
properties.description: Organization's email

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the organization. Can be: Community, Government, Health care provider, Non-profit, Other, R&D, Startup, Traditional Company and University. All names are store in lowercase only.

properties.name: industry
properties.description: Industry from which the organization participates. Plan is for this values to be scraped from linkedin industries.

properties.name: language
properties.description: Field to inidicate the language used by the organization.

properties.name: volunteers
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the organization is seeking volunteers through the app.

properties.name: donations
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the organization is seeking donations through the app.

properties.name: staff
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the organization is seeking staff through the app.

properties.name: other
properties.description: Flag to indicate wheter the organization is seeking other needs through the app.

properties.name: objectives
properties.description: Document with what are the objectives of the organization through the application, such as finding volunteers, staff, investors and donors.

relationships.name: CommentHasNestedComments
relationships.description: Relationship of a Comment with it's parent Comment. This is used for nested Comments. Initially, we support only 1 level of nesting (though the data structure can support more, it's easier for querying).

relationships.name: PostHasComments
relationships.description: Relationship between a Post and it's respective Comments made at it.

relationships.name: UserCreatesComment
relationships.description: Relation between a User and the Comment created by him/her.

relationships.name: UserCreatesPost
relationships.description: Relation between a User and the Post created by him/her.

relationships.name: UserLikesComment
relationships.description:
Relation to represent the User's who liked a Comment. 

Even though this is a N-N relation, we opt to store the ids only at the Comment side as an array of _id (with the _id of the users who liked it).

relationships.name: UserLikesPost
relationships.description:
Relation to represent the User's who liked a Post. 

Even though this is a N-N relation, we opt to store the ids only at the Post side as an array of _id (with the _id of the users who liked it).

relationships.name: UserOwnsOrganization
relationships.description: Relation between an User and an Organization created by him/her. Initially projected as 1-N, with only one User owning the Organization, it is though to later on be evolved into N-N, with many Users being able to manage the Organization with different roles.

properties.description: Location longitude
Location latitude

properties.name: coordinates
properties.description: Array with the coordinates, specifying **longitude first** and **latitude second**, as default in the [GeoJSON](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/geojson/) definition.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Type of the GeoJSON Object.
Please refer to the [official documentation](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/geojson/ ) for more information.

**In our case, the value will always be of the type "Point".**

properties.name: country
properties.description: String holding the country's name.

properties.name: city
properties.description: String holding the city's name.

properties.name: neighborhood
properties.description: String holding the neighborhood's name.

properties.name: address
properties.description: String holding the address (street, number and other details).

properties.name: location
properties.description:
Location document according to the norms of a [GeoJSON Object](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/geojson/ ).
The fields address, neighborhood, city, state and country are added to store the result of the geoprocessing.
